PROFIT TAKING TO WEIGH ON LOCAL MARKET, BUT SEPTEMBER MAY BE BRIGHT   In August, the VN-Index gained 10.4 per cent â€“ the highest growth in the world â€“ and â€œthe growth was based on the efforts of the Government, local authorities and people to restrain the spread of coronavirus,â€ Dinh Quang Hinh, VNDIRECT Securities, head of macroeconomics and market strategy.   Another reason is the positive performance of global stocks, and the Taiwanese fund on the Vietnamese equity market helped boost large-cap stocks.   He forecast the market uptrend may continue in September once the Taiwanese fund starts investing in local assets. The cheap valuation of Vietnamese stocks compared to other regional markets, declining interest rates, better control of the disease, the recovery of trade activities, and improved disbursement of the State budget for State-funded projects will also contribute to this growth.
